head: Doctorate of Philosophy
Electrical and Computer Engineering
Purdue University
phd.body: Advisors: Alexandra Boltasseva, Sabre Kais, Vladimir Shalaev, Alexander Kildishev

head: Quantum Algorithms Graduate Researcher
Quantum Science Center
Purdue University and Oak Ridge National Lab
Machine Learning Team Lead
Founder and Lead
Purdue University
body: Raised $27k in computing resources through grants, saved $40k in ML costs through server maintenance, and assisted in raising $200k+ for the QSC Summer Schools.

Created quantum machine learning algorithms for designing meta-optical devices, achieving a 16200% quantum speed-up resulting in a major milestone for the Quantum Science Center with two news articles and 18 citations [1].

Led 6 researchers to develop transformer ML algorithms for tackling the $75B counterfeit chip market leading to a 55,000x speed-up and 41% accuracy increase in the verification of semiconductor devices. Submitted to CVPR 2024. Patent in progress.

head: Quantum Machine Learning
Algorithms Researcher
QuEra Computing
body: Demonstrated quantum advantage on neutral atoms for generative AI sampling of photonic devices. Publication and patent are underway.
Set team research objectives and wrote quantum simulation software in Python and Julia to simulate Rydberg atom systems for analysis.
Verified early-access, open-source, flagship neutral atom simulation software Bloqade on machine learning sampling tasks.

head: UAV Routing Algorithms
Researcher
Air Force Research Lab
body: Derived optimal UAV routes for search and rescue missions to choose deliveries based on a tradeoff of risk of failure and reward.
Created sweep-covers for partitioning road-networks for multi-UAV routing to capture ground-vehicles.

head: Computer Architecture Design
Software Engineer
ARM
body: Engineered verification software in Python, XML, and C++ for ARMv8 instruction set coverage, leading to a 250% improvement in Chi-Square randomness and immediate positive feedback from customers for improving test consistency.
Rebuilt 2 ARMv8 debug intruction tests in ARM's verification suite to reduce the complexity of debugging for customers.
Designed a 32-Bit MIPS RISC processor in Verilog with L1-Cache and 5-stage pipeline. Compiled C to MIPS IS and benchmarked on FPGA's.
Developed Python to RISCV transpiler for generating Verilog Read-Only-Memory for RISCV-based System-on-Chip.

cvJSON.summary_op: Electrical engineering Ph.D. candidate with 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 8+ years in algorithm design and analysis. Leader of a team of 16 data scientists and engineers developing breakthroughs in machine learning assisted optimization algorithms for applications in computational electromagnetics and quantum optics.
cvJSON.summary_web: Machine Learning Ph.D. candidate with 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 8+ years in algorithm design and analysis. Leader of a team of 16 data scientists and engineers, developing breakthroughs in machine learning with applications in generative AI, computer vision, and quantum.
cvJSON.summary_qml: Quantum machine learning Ph.D. candidate and founder of the NanoML team developing machine learning algorithms for quantum generative AI and photonics. 12+ years of experience in software engineering and 8+ years in algorithm design and analysis.
leadership: NanoMeta Machine Learning Team Lead
Quantum Science Center Summer School Committee
Quantum Science Center PGA Team Lead
Stories of Success: Fireside Chat Host

head: nanomcmc / polytensor
CUDA Computational Physics
Purdue University
body: Identified a need for and developed GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch packages published on PyPi packages, nanomcmc and polytensor with documentation in sphinx.
Packages support several collaborative team projects involving Markov Chain Monte Carlo and polynomial computations leading to a 6000% speed-up over CPU-based algorithms.

head: nanomcmc / polytensor
CUDA Computational Physics
Purdue University
body: Identified a need for and led development of GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch nanomcmc and polytensor packages published on PyPi with documentation in sphinx.
Packages support several collaborative team projects involving Markov Chain Monte Carlo and polynomial computations leading to a 60x speed-up.

head: nanomcmc
CUDA-Accelerated Markov Chain Computation
Purdue University
body: Identified a need and led development of a GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch package for supporting several internal projects that require Markov Chain Monte Carlo, leading to a 6000% speed-up over CPU-based algorithms.

head: Polytensor
CUDA-Accelerated Polynomial Computation
Purdue University
body: Led the development, testing, and research integration of a GPU-accelerated Polynomial computation PyTorch package to support polynomial computation for three energy model projects.
Developed and tested a CUDA-accelerated polynomial computation backend, and documentation in sphinx.

head: Pauli
Pauli Algebra Interpreter and CLI Tool
Purdue University
body: Wrote a Python package for interpreting, parsing and simplifying Pauli algebra expressions using a CLI interpreter and Linux piping, allowing for the use of Pauli algebra in shell scripts.
Developed and tested a tokenizer, recursive descent parser, symbolic Pauli algebra backend, and documentation in sphinx.
